1.content:
You finally wake up after a long night's sleep. Last night, no different from any other summer night--You stayed up late. You have a slight sense of guilt, knowing you told your parents you'd be going to sleep at eleven o'clock and ended up staying past midnight, but that feeling fades away quickly. You look out the window from your bed to see the sun up and shining, the sky still slightly golden from what remains of the sunrise. You then turn to look at the clock - 9:00 AM

You hear the clanking of plates and can now smell the familiar aroma of bacon seeping into your room. You wonder why everyone's up so early. You rest your head back down on your pillow and close your eyes, trying to get the most out of whatever time you have left to sleep-in.

Just as you begin to settle in...
1.title: A hot summer day with nothing to do...

11.content:
"BROTTHHERRRR!!", you hear, shattering your peaceful silence and hopes of sleeping in. Just as you try closing your eyes back shut, you hear the door open up real quick. You're jolted out of your peaceful rest as your bed is pounced on violently by your little sister. "Come on, get up brother, breakfast is ready", she says.

After she finally gets off your bed, you bear the burden of getting up. Once you slowly ease your way off you take nice stretch trying to shake off the unexpected pounding you took. You then get dressed and begin to walk over to the dining room. As you make your way downstairs, you notice the cartoons on the TV and realize it's a Saturday - You always have a early breakfast on Saturdays.

Once you get to the dining room, you see, to your delight, a nice pile of pancakes waiting on a plate just for you. "We've been waiting for you to get up", your mom says. "Yeah", Chloe says. "Well, at least up you're up now." You dig in to your delicious platter, a worthy way of consolation for your violent wake-up. After filling yourself up, you ask to be excused, and go back to your room.

You look for a video game to play, since you have a smaller TV in your bedroom, and the TV downstairs obviously won't be available for a while. After looking for a while, you realize that none of the games you have currently fit your interest.
11.title: Continue...

111.content:
You then grab your wallet off your dresser to see if you have enough money to buy a game. You find three 20's and a 5, and figure that'll be enough to buy a few used games. You then look at the clock - 11:19 - they should be open by now. You walk downstairs and ask Dad if you can go. "Sure", he says. Then you grab your shoes and begin to put them on, "Don't forget to take your phone", Mom says. You finish tying your shoes and then grab your phone and leave.

You almost always walk to the used game store, since it's only a few blocks away. Your family is usually too busy doing their own things during the weekends anyways. The only time your family gets together is usually during dinner, a Saturday breakfast, or during the holidays. Today was forecast to get into the 90's, but so far it felt pretty good outside, and there were some other people outside enjoying the nice weather too.
111.title: Continue...

1111.content:
You then arrive at the game store and notice it's really crowded this morning. What a waste... You think to yourself, disappointed. You then decide to leave, unwilling to weave through traffic, knowing most of the interesting games must be taken by now. Right as you turn to leave, you here someone say "Justin!" You recognize the voice right away, and turn to see your friend Ryan. "Come over here, I've got something for you!" he says, "Oh yeah, what is it?"

"Can't tell ya, It's a surprise", he says.

He leads you into the back room of the store. You've never been in here before, but know that it's used to store whatever games or items they don't have enough room to display. You're astonished by all the games they have here, but what's even more surprising is the fact that they have stairs leading to a basement.

Once you get down there, you see a large kid who looks like he's about two years older than you. He looks like a typical nerd, so you figure he knows some things about video games.

Ryan introduces you to him, and asks the kid to show you his surprise. "I present to you..." he says, "the VIDEO GAME TELEPORTER 3000!!!" You try to hold your laughter down into a slight smirk.

The "TELEPORTER" happens to be an old TV connected to a video game console, and what appears to be the equipment used to take photos of students on 'picture day'.

It looks so hilarious, you decide to take a photo of it on your phone.

"Well, don't you want to try it out?" the kid says.

At first, you figure it's probably just a typical prank by an older kid, but you can tell, by the expression on his face, that he's being serious. You then decide to give it a shot, you really doubt that a high school kid could possibly create something only Willy Wonka could imagine anyway.

"Sure" you say.

"Alright, what game should I should I 'teleport' you to?" the kid asks, eager to test his invention...
1111.title: The Game Store...

11111.content:
"Mario," you say.

"I'm not surprised," he says with a smile on his face.

"Well, sit on that seat while I turn this thing on" he says.

You sit down on the seat, which looks exactly like a chair people would be electrocuted on.

He flips the switch on the console and the TV, and then walks over and fastens the belt on your waist and on your wrists.

"Ready?" he asks.

You nod your head.

Almost immediately after you nod your head, your body goes numb and everything fades to white in a matter of seconds.
11111.title: Mario

111111.content:
You wake up feeling groggy, feeling as if you must have stayed up all night watching TV and fell asleep. You feel real cold and realize you're laying down on a hard marble surface. You then get up and notice it looks like your in some large building, like a temple or palace, you think.

As you look around, you see you're in a large room with two ways to go, a hall leading to a door that obviously goes outside, and a hall that seems to go into a different room.

Which way do you decide to go?
